Bangun Sinergi Penanganan Narkoba, BNN Gelar Pelatihan Internasional
04 Nov 2019, 23:17 by Agus Wijananto


Bangun Sinergi Penanganan Narkoba, BNN Gelar Pelatihan Internasional

KBRN, Lido : Untuk meningkatkan kemampuan personil serta kerjasama penanganan narkotika internasional, Badan Narkotika Nasional (BNN) menyelenggarakan pelatihan bagi penegak hukum narkotika internasional bertajuk "International Training For Law Enforcement" (INARCELL), di Pusat Pengembangan Sumber Daya Manusia (PPSDM) BNN, Lido, Sukabumi, 4 -13 November 2019.Menurut Kepala Biro Humas dan Protokol BNN, Brigjen Sulistyo Pudjo, Pelatihan ini diikuti oleh aparat penegak hukum narkotika dari beberapa negara seperti Arab Saudi, Timor Leste, Kamboja, Thailand, Brunei Darussalam, Kolombia, Papua Nugini dan Seychelles (negara kepulauan yang terletak di Samudera Hindia). "Pelatihan ini bertujuan meningkatkan kerja sama dibidang intelijen dengan seluruh negara yang terlibat," ungkap Pudjo, Senin (4/11/2019).Sebagai tuan rumah pada kegiatan INARCELL, jelas dia, BNN juga bersinergi dengan kementerian/lembaga terkait, seperti Direktorat Jenderal Bea dan Cukai, Kejaksaan Agung, Direktorat Jenderal Imigrasi, Direktorat Jenderal Administrasi Hukum Umum, Badan Keamanan Maritim (Bakamla), dan Polri."Untuk bersama-sama mengikuti pelatihan ini sehingga mendapatkan pemahaman yang sama dan dapat bertukar informasi tentang permasalahan jaringan dan profiling serta situasi terkini tentang narkotika secara nasional maupun internasional," terang Pudjo.Berbagai materi yang  disajikan selama sembilan hari kedepan diantaranya adalah Informan Handling, Dark Web, Analisis Pencucian Uang, Hand Writing Analysis, Mutual Legal Assistance, Extradition, dan Operasi Interdiksi Terpadu yang berkaitan dengan program Pencegahan dan Pemberantasan Penyalahgunaan dan Peredaran Gelap Narkotika (P4GN).Materi tersebut akan disampaikan oleh instruktur profesional dari berbagai lembaga penegak hukum nasional maupun internasional, yaitu Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA), Australian Border Force (ABF), United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC), NZ Police, BNN, Polri, Kementerian Hukum dan HAM, dan Kementerian Keuangan.Pelatihan internasional ini merupakan implementasi serta tindak lanjut dari MoU yang telah dibuat BNN dengan negara mitra serta kementerian/lembaga terkait sebagai wujud komitmen bersama dalam P4GN."Bagi Indonesia, pelatihan gabungan bertaraf internasional ini adalah salah satu bentuk upaya dalam memperkuat Rencana Aksi Nasional yang telah disusun dalam rangka penanganan permasalahan narkotika di Indonesia," pungkas Pudjo.

Building Synergy in Drug Management, BNN Holds International Training
Nov. 04 2019, 23:17 by Agus Wijananto


Building Synergy in Drug Management, BNN Holds International Training

KBRN, Lido: To improve the ability of personnel and cooperation in handling international narcotics, the National Narcotics Agency (BNN) organizes training for international narcotics law enforcement titled "International Training For Law Enforcement" (INARCELL), at the Center for Human Resources Development (PPSDM) BNN, Lido, Sukabumi, 4 -13 November 2019. According to the Head of the BNN Public Relations and Protocol Bureau, Brigadier General Sulistyo Pudjo, this training was participated in by narcotics law enforcement officers from several countries such as Saudi Arabia, Timor Leste, Cambodia, Thailand, Brunei Darussalam, Colombia, Papua New Guinea and Seychelles (an island nation located in the Indian Ocean). "This training aims to increase cooperation in the intelligence field with all countries involved," said Pudjo, Monday (11/04/2019). As the host of INARCELL activities, he explained, BNN also synergized with relevant ministries / institutions, such as the Directorate General Customs and Excise, Attorney General's Office, Directorate General of Immigration, Directorate General of Public Law Administration, Maritime Security Agency (Bakamla), and the National Police. "To jointly participate in this training so as to get the same understanding and be able to exchange information about network and profiling issues as well as the current situation on narcotics nationally and internationally, "explained Pudjo.Various material presented over the next nine days included Informant Handling, Dark Web, Money Laundering Analysis, Hand Writing Analysis, Mutual Legal Assistance, Extradition, and Integrated Interdiction Operations relating to the Na Darkness Abuse and Circulation Prevention and Eradication program rotaika (P4GN). The material will be delivered by professional instructors from various national and international law enforcement agencies, namely Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA), Australian Border Force (ABF), United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC), NZ Police, BNN, Polri, Ministry of Law and Human Rights, and Ministry of Finance. This international training is the implementation and follow-up of the MoU that has been made by BNN with partner countries and related ministries / institutions as a form of joint commitment in P4GN. "For Indonesia, international standard joint training "This is an effort to strengthen the National Action Plan that has been prepared in the context of handling narcotics problems in Indonesia," concluded Pudjo.
